channel.title: [PI] Stupid bright green tree's
channel.description:
So, i'm trying to fix the tree's because half the tree's look normal & the other half are pretty much lime green & i checked everywhere on how to fix it & it say's to delete 1570.dat from the raw folder, which i dont have so i used tom's cache editor & found 1570 but you cant delete it; So i tried to replace it with a working tree model, & i still have the stupid lime green tree's.
Basically, is there a way for me to get rid of these dumb lime green tree's because i've looked everywhere & i am honestly 100% clueless.
-This is probably posted in the wrong spot but i honestly don't know exactally where to post this because i've never had to really mess with cache.

item.title: [PI] Stupid bright green tree's
item.dc:creator: @kingcobra805 kingcobra805
item.description:
@kingcobra805 wrote:

Isn’t there a way to decompress the models.dat & models.idx?

Also, what do you use to compress the models into the .dat&.idx extension?
i looked around and was not sure if i found the correct one’s…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Stupid bright green tree's
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

You probably have a compressed model.dat file, now what you can try, is get a 317 pi cache (which is already quite extended) and add the model to that Raw folder and then compress those models into 1 model.dat file and just replace it (make a backup of it though before you decide to erase it!)

Read full topic
